itemListElement.name: Asian Chicken Lettuce Wraps (Better than P.F. Chang's)!

@graph.headline: Asian Chicken Lettuce Wraps (Better than P.F. Chang's)!

@graph.name: What lettuce is best for wraps?

acceptedAnswer.text:
There are three varieties of lettuce that I recommend to use when making these chicken lettuce wraps:
- Butterhead lettuce
- Green Leaf Lettuce
- Romaine Lettuce
Just be sure to choose a head of lettuce that has large and flexible enough leaves to use as a wrap!

@graph.name: How do you cut lettuce for lettuce wraps?

acceptedAnswer.text: It's actually very simple! Just cut the bottom part of the head of lettuce off. Then carefully peel away each lettuce leaf! Don't forget to wash and dry the lettuce leaves before serving!

video.name: Asian Chicken Lettuce Wraps (Better than P.F. Chang's)!
video.description: This Asian Chicken Lettuce Wraps recipe is better than P.F. Chang’s! It's a quick (less than 30 minutes), easy, and healthy dinner or appetizer that tastes delicious! Gluten and dairy-free!

recipeIngredient: 1 8 oz can water chestnuts (drained and minced)
Lettuce or your favorite Asian salad

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together sauce ingredients until well combined. If you use a firmer peanut butter you may need to microwave the mixture for 30-60 seconds in order to melt it and ensure everything is well-mixed.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk together sauce ingredients until well combined. If you use a firmer peanut butter you may need to microwave the mixture for 30-60 seconds in order to melt it and ensure everything is well-mixed.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 TBS peanut oil in a frying pan. Once hot, add ground chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 2 TBS peanut oil in a frying pan. Once hot, add ground chicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook until some pieces are starting to brown. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until the onion is becoming translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook until some pieces are starting to brown. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until the onion is becoming translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the peppers and water chestnuts and cook about 5 minutes or until peppers are becoming soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the peppers and water chestnuts and cook about 5 minutes or until peppers are becoming soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Add sauce and simmer on low heat until the chicken and veggies are evenly coated and everything is heated through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce and simmer on low heat until the chicken and veggies are evenly coated and everything is heated through.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve in lettuce leaves, on top of your favorite Asian salad, or over noodles or rice!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve in lettuce leaves, on top of your favorite Asian salad, or over noodles or rice!
